text: Leila Janah (October 9, 1982 - January 24, 2020) was an American businesswoman. She was the Founder and CEO of Samasource and LXMI. She was also the author of Give Work: Reversing Poverty One Job at a Time and co- author of America's Moment: Creating Opportunity in the Connected Age. Janah was born in Lewiston, New York. Janah died on January 24, 2020 in San Francisco, California from a rare-form of soft-tissue sarcoma, aged 37.Samasource CEO Leila Janah passes away at 37 ==References== Category:1982 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from soft-tissue sarcoma Category:Cancer deaths in San Francisco Category:Businesspeople from New York (state) Category:Businesspeople from San Francisco Category:Writers from San Francisco Category:Writers from New York (state)
title: Leila Janah
